name: Glen Maddern
bio: Glen Maddern is an independent front-end web developer, consultant & presenter. A reformed backend developer, he now spends his time trying to optimise users' experiences within the browser and the developers' experience in creating them. He's one of the authors of CSS Modules & helps organise CSSConf AU and JSConf AU.

name: Stephanie Rieger
bio: Stephanie is a designer, researcher and closet anthropologist with a passion for the many ways people interact with technology. A mobile industry veteran with a keen eye on emerging technologies, Stephanie speaks at conferences and teaches workshops on design and strategy all over the world. She is also co-founder and principal at yiibu, a small yet perfectly-formed design consultancy that explores the human impact of embedding technology into every day life.

name: Robert Nyman
bio: Robert is a strong believer in the Open Web, and has been working since 1999 with Front End development in Sweden and in New York City. He's currently at Google, being the Global Lead for Developer Feedback & Communities for the Web Platform, and working with making the web the best platform for developers. He also loves to travel and meet people. Robert has presented in 36 countries, and holds claim to the title of most well-travelled speaker on Lanyrd. He is listed by Twitter as one of 23 Swedes to follow and 5th best developer in Sweden. He has also run Geek Meet in Stockholm since 2006 – one of the first of its kind for web developers in Sweden.

name: Bruce Lawson
bio: Opera’s Deputy Chief Technology Officer. He’s been involved in explaining and making web standards since 2002. He co-wrote the first book on HTML5, contributed to the W3C’s Mobile Web Best Practices, and was a member of the Web Standards Project.

name: Mathias Bynens
bio: Mathias is a Belgian web standards enthusiast. He likes HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Unicode, performance, and security. At Opera Software he’s a member of the Developer Relations team.
